isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC) SYSTEM - ProStar - REMOVE AND INSTALL - REAR HVAC UNIT, COMPLETE

svcprocinfo.para: In order to repair internal components, the rear HVAC unit may be disassembled in the cab or removed as a unit and disassembled on the bench. The method used depends on the repair being performed.

Removing and installing the rear HVAC unit as an assembly requires discharging the A/C system and disconnecting the rear heater core lines. All internal components of the rear HVAC unit can be replaced by removing the top of the housing while the unit is mounted in the vehicle. Removal of the entire rear HVAC unit is necessary only if the lower housing itself is damaged. In this situation, it may be beneficial to remove the entire rear HVAC unit from the vehicle so the repairs can be performed on the bench, before re-installing the unit into the vehicle. Whenever the rear HVAC unit is removed or installed, the heater core inlet/outlet tubes should be removed to prevent damage to the tubes.

step1.para: Set ignition key to OFF.
Discharge A/C system. Refer to DISCHARGING THE SYSTEM .
If the vehicle is equipped with aerodynamic skirts, remove the rear passenger side skirt.

note.para: It may be easier to disconnect the hoses in the following step if the rear AC/heater line hanger is loosened or removed.

In the following step the threaded stud may unscrew from the TXV body. If so, examine the condition of the stud and the retaining nut. If possible, clean the existing stud and install it into the TXV body. Otherwise, install a new threaded stud. Retain the mounting nut, or replace if necessary.

step1.para: From under the vehicle, disconnect the A/C lines from the Thermostatic Expansion Valve (TXV). Refer to Figure 58. Retain the lock plate and lock plate retaining nut. Plug all open tubes/ports.
Using clamping pliers, pinch the rubber section of the rear heater lines closed. Place the clamps several inches from the metal/rubber joint ( Figure 53).
With a clean drain pan positioned under the heater core connections, disconnect the hoses from the heater core. Plug all open tubes/hoses.
Inside the sleeper, raise and support the lower bunk.
Remove the rear heater core and heater core inlet/outlet tubes ( Figure 55), as follows.

step2.para: Remove the 2 screws securing the heater core cover. Remove the cover.

note.para: In the following step it may be easier to remove the clamp plate by raising the heater core slightly out of its cavity.

step2.para: Remove the clamp plate securing the heater core inlet and outlet tubes to the core. Disconnect the tubes from the core, and rotate them out of the way.
Remove the heater core.
Remove the heater core inlet and outlet tubes.

step1.para: Disconnect all electrical connections to the rear HVAC unit.

step2.para: Rear HVAC controller - 1 connector
blend door actuator - 1 connector
outlet duct temperature sensor - 1 connector
rear linear power module - 1 connector (harness). NOTE: Connector to blower can remain connected.

step1.para: Remove the rear HVAC unit outlet duct (1 screw). NOTE: It may be helpful to loosen or remove some connected duct work.
Remove inlet grille from front of bunk to provide additional clearance.
Remove 5 bolts securing housing to floor ( Figure 60).
Support bunk with a separate prop; then, disconnect the bottom of the bunk support strut and position it out of the way.
Carefully remove the rear HVAC unit through the passenger side access door.
Lower or secure the bunk to prevent accidental closure.

figure.caption: Figure 60. Rear HVAC Unit Mounting Bolt Locations

note.para: To prevent damaging the heater core inlet/outlet tubes, the heater core and tubes should not be installed into the rear HVAC unit until the unit is installed in the vehicle. If necessary remove the heater core and tubes from the rear HVAC unit prior to installing the unit into the vehicle.

step1.para: Support bunk with a sturdy, secure prop. The bottom connection of the regular strut must be disconnected.
Verify that the rear HVAC unit is ready for installation, as follows.

step2.para: Expansion valve is installed and ready for lower locking plate.
Foam seal surrounding TXV cavity is installed.
Spacer and foam seal for heater core inlet/outlet tubes is installed.
Foam seals at air intake and side outlet are installed and undamaged.

step1.para: Carefully place the rear HVAC unit into the sleeper through the passenger side access door.
Without damaging the foam air seals, position the rear HVAC unit to align the holes for the mounting bolts ( Figure 60).
Secure the unit to the floor with 5 bolts.
Install the rear HVAC unit outlet air duct (1 screw). Verify that all related duct work is positioned and secured correctly.
Install the inlet grille at the front of bunk.
Install the rear heater core and heater core inlet/outlet tubes ( Figure 55), as follows.

step2.para: Noting the position of the foam spacer and seal (below the housing), carefully install the heater core inlet and outlet tubes and rotate them out of the way.
Install the heater core.

note.para: In the following step it may be easier to insert the inlet/outlet tubes by raising the heater core slightly out of its cavity.

step2.para: Using new O-rings, insert the heater core inlet and outlet tubes into the core and secure with the clamp plate.
Install heater core cover and secure with 2 screws.

step1.para: Connect all electrical connections to the rear HVAC unit.

step2.para: blend door actuator - 1 connector
outlet duct temperature sensor - 1 connector
linear power module - 2 connectors (harness and blower, blower connector may not have been disconnected).
Rear HVAC controller - 1 connector

step1.para: Connect the bottom of the bunk support strut to its mounting plate.

From under the vehicle, using new lubricated O-rings, connect the A/C lines to the Thermostatic Expansion Valve (TXV). Secure the lines to the TXV using the lower locking plate and the lock plate retaining nut ( Figure 58). Tighten to 9,000 to 10,000 N.mm (80 to 90 lbf-in).
Connect the heater core inlet/outlet hoses to the heater core tubes ( Figure 54). Install or tighten the rear AC/heater line hanger, if removed earlier.
Remove the clamping pliers used to pinch the heater lines closed.
Add coolant drained during removal, to the coolant system.

Recharge A/C system. Refer to CHARGING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.
If the vehicle is equipped with aerodynamic skirts, install the rear passenger side skirt.
Calibration of the blend door actuator will occur the next time the IGN key is set to IGN or ACCESSORY.
